pros: The opportunity to work and engage with interesting, experienced people. Professional networking.
cons: Leadership is weak and the organization as a whole lacks strategic vision. Lots of self-dealing among staff. Additionally, you have members of the organization in senior leadership roles which further blurs the lines of responsibility. This organization is a vanity project that talks a big game but contributes little in terms of substantive impact.

review_title: Toxic and confusing workplace, do not recommend
pros: Synergos has a strong global network. People who work here tend to make a lot of new connections. The organization also has very committed, smart employees at the entry level and in middle management.
cons: Synergos is very poorly managed and operated. The organization has not had a clear strategy in at least 5 years. The actual activities of the organization are vague and not clear even to those who work there. The majority of revenue goes to staff salaries. The organization has had a lot of executive leadership turnover in the last 6 years. They started a three-person co-CEO team in 2021. Rather than let go of the previous CEO who mismanaged a strategy process and wasted resources they instead brought in two other women to take on 2/3 of his work . The organization is founder-driven, which in turn contributes to a culture of fear and confusion. The founder does not listen to staff feedback. Employees that do speak up, and with whom she disagrees, are often shamed and excluded. The founder also talks negatively about these employees to their peers. There are no professional development pathways for staff. Promotions are given out haphazardly and to those with the loudest internal advocates. At least 8 staff left in 2021 because of these conditions. All of these factors contribute to a very challenging, toxic work environment. It is unfortunate because Synergos presents well to those on the outside, which is not an accurate representation.

pros: Wirk life balance is there
cons: Nothing specific in the cons

Good place to work

cons: Seems their business model needs to review

pros: Good place to work. Nice colleagues and organization's partners.
cons: The salaries for employees above the admin level were significantly higher creating a salary disparity. Little room for growth.

pros: Warm working environment with diverse employees
cons: Part time internships may be unpaid

review_title: Research, project management, stakeholder engagement and management
pros: Growth, per diem allowances, healthcare benefits
cons: Company bureaucracy, irregular pay, favouritism,

review_title: Salary as a manager at synergos
job_title: Program Manager in New York, NY
pros: Team-oriented; Program focused; systems thinking approach
cons: Siloed teams; advancement; small company

pros: The work was very meaningful and you felt that you were making a positive difference in the lives of others. The team was amazing.
cons: It was challenging work and we often felt overstretched and under-resourced and had to work long hours with few benefits or recognition for your work. But such is the nature of non-profit work.

review_title: Great organization with qualified professionals but no clear direction and poor management
pros: Highly qualified group of individuals
cons: Agile not implemented well and there is no clear path for professional growth

review_title: If you are interested in poverty and social justice work, this a great place to get started or enrich your experience
pros:
For a relatively small NGO Synergos has a lot to offer :
- connected to networks of leaders in development and business
- access to philanthropists and civil society leaders around the world
- the approach of working with collaborations and partnerships across sectors, public and private  -is important and is gaining currency
- interesting people, diverse community of employees with offices in Africa, North and South America and the Middle East
- many opportunities for learning 
- generous benefits
cons: Like many other NGOs, there are challenges with transitions and changes, and a tendency to operate in silos.  The organization is working to improve this. The work heavily emphasizes process - partly because of this, decision-making can be frustratingly slow.

pros:
I had a great experience as an intern at Synergos' Global Philanthropists Circle. I was given a variety of tasks from which I learned a lot about non-profit management, including social media advertising, creating a financial budget, and navigating various databases. My supervisor geared the internship towards my specific interests so most of my work consisted of doing things that I enjoyed. 
The team was also great and very welcoming! I always really enjoyed lunch breaks when I got to meet people from different sectors and learn about their backgrounds. I would recommend Synergos to anyone!
cons: It was an unpaid internship; however many universities provide additional scholarships for students pursuing non-paid internships in the city. :)

pros: The team at Synergos is incredibly smart and incredibly kind.  A winning combination.  The management team works well together and has the back of the rest of the staff.
cons: Under new leadership, they are working in including a stronger voice of the international teams at the management table. A move in the right direction.

job_title: Human Resources Intern in New York, NY
pros: I worked with HR team for over three months.  Synergos performed as a professional and collaborative community, they taught me a lot with HRIS system and you will gain many opportunity to participate meeting, workshops, and global projects
cons: Nothing that I want to mention as Cons

pros: Great organization! The whole Synergos community gives me the feelings of love and professionalism. All the people in finance department taught me a lot and are always patient to me. HR Katie is very helpful and understanding. It's a great time working in Synergos.
cons: Not that I can remember

review_title: GPC Intern at the Synergos Institute - good company
job_title: Global Philanthropist in New York, NY
pros: Synergos maintains a very friendly atmosphere in which you can be comfortable asking anybody in the office for help or advice.
cons: During my time there,  the office was going through a transition period and was exceptionally disorganized.

review_title: Great place to work and learn
pros: Great learning experience and introduction into the non-profit space. I had an amazing manager who really made sure each intern got the most out of their time there.
cons: Organization was going through an awkward transition.

pros: Real internship experience and the ability to learn a wide range of human resource functions that you would need to succeed in the job field
cons: None at all that I can think of.

review_title: Many opportunities to learn, but quality of work depends on your department/supervisor
pros: A lot of fun people, extremely diverse colleagues, the opportunity to learn about issues in developing countries, high-profile philanthropists.
cons: The nature of the work itself can get tedious.
